Summary Recognized as a trusted legal advisor for new technology solutions, platforms and innovative products.  
 
Specialties: Intellectual property law, "wearables", privacy, data security, law department strategy, program management, knowledge management and legal education. Summary Recognized as a trusted legal advisor for new technology solutions, platforms and innovative products.

Experience Group Counsel Intel Corporation July 2014  – Present (1 year 2 months) Santa Clara, CA Lead advisor to the Vice President and GM of the New Devices Group at Intel. Provide strategic counsel on all legal matters as the New Devices Group develops and launches its products and platforms. Responsible for legal support for business development, sales, M&A, and joint development relationships. Collaborate across Intel on a variety of legal areas including privacy, security and public policy. Serve as General Counsel to Basis Science, an Intel Company (http://www.mybasis.com), acquired by Intel in May 2014. Lead Counsel, Global Knowledge Management Intel Corporation March 2012  –  December 2014  (2 years 10 months) Santa Clara, CA Responsible for all knowledge management programs for Intel’s Legal department worldwide. Provide strategic direction, implementation, and oversight of innovative processes and content, enabling individual attorneys to benefit from the collective expertise of Intel’s entire legal department. Drive initiatives to capture and share explicit and tacit knowledge through the use of wiki- and web-based resources, social networking tools, post-engagement reviews, content creation and working forums. Drafted and negotiated intellectual property licenses, collaboration, evaluation, non-disclosure, and marketing agreements. Summary Experienced senior legal counsel with a unique blend of legal acuity and strong business acumen as well as expertise in product development, manufacturing, sales, services, marketing, systems integration, e-commerce, regulation, joint ventures and compliance. Advising senior leadership on major business transactions and diverse legal/risk management issues. Possesses comprehensive regulatory compliance, broad international transaction and telecommunications regulatory litigation experience. Sound judgment, flexibility, and critical thinking with a practical and business-friendly approach. 
 
SELECT CAREER HIGHLIGHTS: 
►	Led team supporting Intel’s strategic shift to develop, manufacture and sell Intel platforms for smart-phones and tablets including industrial design & mobile platform standards. 
►	Reduced legal cycle time by streamlining licensing process and implemented legal processes to minimize the time and complexity of licensing Intel's intellectual property by making wide-spread use of evergreen documents and click-to-accept agreements 
►	Forged legal strategies for various Intel start-ups, such as Digital Health Product Group 
►	Won regulatory authority for Sprint to enter $2B California local toll market producing an immediate $120M revenue increase. 
►	Won $250M reduction in access charges litigating telecommunications regulation in 18 states. 
►	Obtained operating authority in 18 western states allowing Sprint to be the first competitive telecommunications carrier with intrastate authority in all 50 states. 
►	Conducted FTC merger analysis and enforcement of largest energy merger of its time. 
 
 
EXPERTISE: ▪ Intellectual Property ▪ Technology Licensing ▪ Patent Cross-Licensing ▪ Antitrust 
▪ International Commercial Transactions ▪ Regulatory Compliance ▪ Contract Drafting & Negotiations 
▪ Privacy, Data Security ▪ Strategic Business Planning ▪ Litigation/Dispute Resolution ▪ Health care/FDA compliance ▪ Industry Standards Expertise ▪ Wireless Technologies Summary Experienced senior legal counsel with a unique blend of legal acuity and strong business acumen as well as expertise in product development, manufacturing, sales, services, marketing, systems integration, e-commerce, regulation, joint ventures and compliance. Advising senior leadership on major business transactions and diverse legal/risk management issues. EXPERTISE: ▪ Intellectual Property ▪ Technology Licensing ▪ Patent Cross-Licensing ▪ Antitrust 
▪ International Commercial Transactions ▪ Regulatory Compliance ▪ Contract Drafting & Negotiations 
▪ Privacy, Data Security ▪ Strategic Business Planning ▪ Litigation/Dispute Resolution ▪ Health care/FDA compliance ▪ Industry Standards Expertise ▪ Wireless Technologies Experience Senior Counsel for Intel's Mobile Communications Group (tablets & phones) Intel Corporation December 2012  –  June 2014  (1 year 7 months) Global ▪	Counseled the division’s senior management. 
▪	Successfully partnered with internal and external stakeholders to develop and execute key initiatives supporting Intel’s strategic shift to develop, manufacture and sell Intel platforms for smartphones and tablets including industrial design and mobile platform standards. 
▪	Provided legal support for establishing Intel as a credible player in the already established tablet and phone market segment. 
▪	Reduced legal cycle time by streamlining licensing process. Implemented legal processes to minimize the time and complexity of licensing Intel's intellectual property by making wide-spread use of evergreen documents and click-to-accept agreements. Director of Legal Affairs for Netbook & Tablet Group Intel Corporation April 2011  –  December 2012  (1 year 9 months) Global ▪ Provided proactive legal support and counsel; led the team supporting Intel’s platform planning, architecture and marketing of Intel's Netbook and Tablets market segments.  
▪ Counseled business regarding a wide array of commercial issues including strategic partnerships, product commercialization/launch, contracts, licensing, online services, intellectual property, security, privacy, fraud prevention. 
▪ Closed deals with new customer segments (retailers and non-computing manufacturers) using non-standard terms. 
▪ Provided significant hand-holding and support to encourage established computing companies to launch Intel Architect tablets during a period when tablet devices were not being taken seriously. Senior Licensing Counsel Intel Corporation January 2006  –  March 2011  (5 years 3 months) Global ▪ Drafted, reviewed and negotiated a variety of commercial technology transactions and license agreements. Negotiated key strategic licensing projects; spearheaded patent cross-licenses and segments of the corporate patent strategy 
▪ Developed, evangelized, and launched the Open Patent Alliance (OPA), a broad alliance of technology industry companies, to among other things establish a WiMAX patent Pool;. OPA was formed to accelerate the widespread adoption and deployment of WiMAX technology and products. Counseled on all legal issues including corporate governance, early development of potential licensing terms, formation, structure and operation of a WIMAX patent pool, licensing terms and conditions, and other issues in IP and antitrust law. 
▪ Provided legal compliance and risk mitigation leadership and expertise in the conception, development, design, and testing of new technology products, services, and processes. Director of Legal Affairs Intel Corporation Digital Health Group December 2004  –  December 2005  (1 year 1 month) Global Architected and implemented legal intellectual property & regulatory strategy for healthcare startup. Group Counsel Intel Corporation's Microsoft Program Office & Sony Program Office January 2002  –  December 2004  (3 years) Global Managed the complex legal relationship between Intel and Microsoft, and Intel and Sony. Group Counsel Intel Corporation, Intel Archeticture Marketing Group September 2001  –  December 2002  (1 year 4 months) Global Led legal strategy for all of the marketing functions for the core Intel Architecture product groups (desktops, mobile, server and workstation). Group Counsel Intel Corporation Workstation Product Group & Enterprise Technology Center January 1999  –  January 2000  (1 year 1 month) Global Lead counsel for Intel’s Workstation Product group & Intel-led inter-company enterprise platform design center. Part of senior management team, which grew the business from $0 to billion in revenues in span of 3 years. General Counsel Sprint Corporation (United Telephone Company of the Northwest) October 1994  –  December 1998  (4 years 3 months) Northwest US Managed all aspects of legal and regulatory matters for Northwest operations of Sprint's local telephone company, including: 
•	Commercial Transactions: Technology licensing, cellular antenna site leasing, network interconnection & Internet service provider (ISP) agreements. 
•	Litigation/Dispute Resolution: Successfully litigated company matters, including negotiating resolution of all significant company disputes. 
•	Human Resources/Labor/Security: Provided legal counsel and training for all human resource matters in both union and non-union environments. 
•	Regulatory/Antitrust: Successfully reduced scope of regulation for company. Senior Regulatory Attorney Sprint 1987  –  1994  (7 years) Western US, including Alaska & Hawaii •	Won regulatory authority for Sprint to enter $2 billion California local toll market producing immediate $120 million increase in revenues. 
•	Won $250M reduction in access charges litigating telco regulation in 18 states. 
•	Obtained operating authority in 18 western states allowing Sprint to be the first competitive telco carrier with intrastate authority in all 50 states. General Attorney Federal Trade Commission March 1984  –  September 1987  (3 years 7 months) General Attorney in Washington, DC, enforcing Federal antitrust laws; conducting merger and antitrust investigations; and litigating in Federal Administrative, District and Appeals courts in the areas of telecommunications, information technologies/devices and energy. Summary Currently serve as Director for Intel's Product Group Legal team in China. Directly manage product group legal team, handle complex IP transactional matters and provide IP transaction training throughout Asia. 
 
Prior roles within Intel included: 
 
- Group Counsel for Intel's Desktop Client Platforms group and Client Strategic Planning group - both part of Intel's PC Client Group. 
 
- leading business legal and compliance matters between Intel and our wholly owned software subsidiaries, including McAfee and Wind River; 
 
- managing Intel's legal relationships with Google, Microsoft and Oracle; 
 
- driving strategic patent licensing projects such as cross licenses, covenants not to sue, and M&A related licensing.  
 
Immediately before joining Intel, I was a partner at Squire, Sanders and Dempsey located in the firms Tokyo office. 
 
Outside of work, I have spoken numerous times at various industry-based intellectual property organizations, including Licensing Executives Society and the Intellectual Property Owners groups. 
 
Specialties: IP Licensing 
Joint ventures and collaborations 
M&A 
Cross-border transactions Summary Currently serve as Director for Intel's Product Group Legal team in China. Directly manage product group legal team, handle complex IP transactional matters and provide IP transaction training throughout Asia. 
 
Prior roles within Intel included: 
 
- Group Counsel for Intel's Desktop Client Platforms group and Client Strategic Planning group - both part of Intel's PC Client Group. 
 
- leading business legal and compliance matters between Intel and our wholly owned software subsidiaries, including McAfee and Wind River; 
 
- managing Intel's legal relationships with Google, Microsoft and Oracle; 
 
- driving strategic patent licensing projects such as cross licenses, covenants not to sue, and M&A related licensing.  
 
Immediately before joining Intel, I was a partner at Squire, Sanders and Dempsey located in the firms Tokyo office. 
 
Outside of work, I have spoken numerous times at various industry-based intellectual property organizations, including Licensing Executives Society and the Intellectual Property Owners groups. 
 
Specialties: IP Licensing 
Joint ventures and collaborations 
M&A

Summary Attorney with corporate, technology licensing, intellectual property, privacy and international experience Summary Attorney with corporate, technology licensing, intellectual property, privacy and international experience Attorney with corporate, technology licensing, intellectual property, privacy and international experience Attorney with corporate, technology licensing, intellectual property, privacy and international experience Experience Group Counsel Intel Corporation June 2015  – Present (3 months) Deputy General Counsel Nextag, Inc. (Wize Commerce) September 2013  –  April 2015  (1 year 8 months) San Mateo, California Wize Commerce has been in the e-commerce business for over 10 years, helping merchants make over $1B a year with its global network of shopping sites, and technologies that optimize revenue and traffic across every channel, device and digital ecosystem in 15 countries using the Wize Commerce platform. 
 
As Deputy General Counsel for Wize Commerce, I have responsibility for legal matters, including corporate transactions; intellectual property; commercial relationships with merchants, vendors and partners; marketing and social media guidance; data privacy; U.S. and international corporate governance; HR support and employee matters; and disputes and litigation. Senior International Counsel Nextag, Inc. (Wize Commerce) March 2011  –  September 2013  (2 years 7 months) San Mateo, California At Wize Commerce, I supported the company’s operation of international price comparison websites in 15 countries. I provided legal advice to sales, marketing, HR as well as corporate governance for subsidiaries in Germany, U.K., Ireland, India and Japan. I participated in cross functional projects such as corporate acquisitions, tax restructuring for an international headquarters in Ireland, liquidations and office closures. In my position I also provided review and advice on data privacy, user tracking, cookies, advertising, webpage content, trademark matters and litigation disputes. Associate General Counsel Silicon Graphics International Corp. September 2010  –  February 2011  (6 months) Fremont, California Silicon Graphics is a NASDAQ-traded high-performance computing, storage and Big Data solutions company with operations in more than 20 countries worldwide. As Associate General Counsel I had responsibility to: 
 
•	Draft and negotiate commercial contracts, including sales, customer service, licensing, professional services, strategic alliance and product distribution through resellers, distributors and agents in the U.S., Asia Pacific, Latin America and Europe 
•	Draft and negotiate intellectual property contracts for joint development, technology licenses for hardware products, inbound and outbound software licenses, and NRE funding agreements 
•	Provide guidance regarding compliance with various worldwide laws, including environmental waste and recycling, Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and export compliance 
•	Support HR in worldwide employee restructuring, terminations, investigations, code of conduct violations and data privacy issues 
•	Provide guidance on best practices for compliance with internal finance policies, audits and revenue recognition 
•	Assist Finance teams in collection of outstanding debt, vendor bankruptcy matters, audits and tax issues 
•	Manage subpoena requests and document retention issues Corporate Counsel Silicon Graphics International Corp. (formerly Rackable Systems) May 2009  –  September 2010  (1 year 5 months) Sunnyvale, California •	Support Finance and Business Development teams in post-sale transition issues related to the sale and spin off of four subsidiaries and due diligence for strategic acquisitions  
•	Responsible for worldwide litigation, managing cases with outside counsel and directing settlement discussions, including successful settlement of litigation brought against subsidiary in which company received $2.7 M. 
•	Participate in cross functional projects such as liquidation of subsidiaries, employee restructuring, compliance with hazardous materials regulations, update of factory warranty, product shipment terms, tax and government audits, contract renovation  
•	Managed paralegals, commercial contract negotiators and escalation point for Federal contract negotiators 
•	Manage corporate governance matters for eighteen corporate subsidiaries 
•	Provided legal support of transition issues to merge the operations of company and acquirer, including the revision of worldwide terms and conditions of sale and service to conform to new company policies and direction 
•	Draft and negotiate commercial and corporate contracts Corporate Counsel Silicon Graphics, Inc. November 2000  –  May 2009  (8 years 7 months) Mountain View, California •	Review and negotiate vendor and consulting contracts for the purchase of goods and services 
•	Counsel business units on areas such as procurement of hardware products, product development, supply chain management, outsourcing, design and development activities, establishing contract manufacturers, intellectual property analysis, and environmental matters related to product distribution  
•	Support marketing to review all collateral, such as press releases, presentations, brochures and trademark compliance 
•	Support the Facilities team in management of worldwide real estate leases, subleases and terminations  
•	Resided part-time in Reading, U.K. to support European legal operations as sole counsel during periods in 2007 and 2009 
•	Provided substantial pre and post bankruptcy organization and advice during 2006 Chapter 11 bankruptcy and 2009 Section 363 bankruptcy sale of operating assets Deputy City Attorney City of Santa Clara 1998  –  2000  (2 years) Santa Clara, California Practiced municipal law with emphasis on procurement, construction, utility regulations, as well as litigation of civil, criminal and administrative matters.
